otupy

  • otupy.core.transfer.Transfer

otupy.core.transfer.Transfer

class Transfer

Bases: object

Transfer protocol

This is the base class for all implementation of Transfer protocols.

Methods

receive

Receives a Message

send

Sends a Message
receive(callback, encoder)

Receives a Message

Listen for incoming Message`s and dispatches them to the `Actuator. This method may be blocking or non-blocking.

The expected signature for the callback function:

callback(cmd: otupy.Message)

Parameters:

  • callback – the Consumer.dispatch function that contains the logic to dispatch a Message to one or more Actuator

  • encode – the default Encoder instance to encode/decode Messages. Implementations might use the information carried within OpenC2 Messages to derive the Encoder instance (retrieved from the Encoders variable.

Returns:

None

send(msg, encoder)

Sends a Message

Encodes, sends a message, and returns the response.

Implementations of this method may return either a plain Message or a list of Messages; the latter option is expected for those implementation that support delivery to multiple Consumers. Each Transfer implmentation shall use either options consistently (e.g., it should always return either a plain object or a list of objects). Callers of this method must be prepared to manage the two cases, by leveraging the knowledge of the Transfer implementation they are using. In any case, implementations must guarantee the uniqueness of returned Messages (i.e., duplicates must be discarded by the Transfer protocol).

Parameters:

  • msg – an otupy Message to send

  • encoder – the Encoder to be used

Returns:

An otupy Message or a list of Message`s that contains the `Response`(s) to the sent `Command.
